diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Exogenous Lipoid Pneumonia due to Vaseline Oil Intoxication
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Exogenous lipoid pneumonia was suspected based on the patient's history of using large quantities of vaseline oil, confirmed by the presence of lipid-laden macrophages in bronchoalveolar lavage fluid and matching nuclear magnetic resonance and infrared spectra with the vaseline oil taken by the patient.
